location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government

mods.abstract: Letter reports the return of Stephen Watson Henshaw from Charrack [Bandar-e ChƒÅrak], and lists all of the items that Henshaw was able to recover from Abdella ben Ahmed [Abdullah bin Ahmad]. William Bruce recounts further details of Henshaw's mission, including the views of various chiefs along the coast on the conduct of Abdella ben Ahmed. Bruce states that he has written a letter to Shaik Kulfan [Shaikh Khalfan] of Assaloo [Bandar-e `Asaluyeh ], thanking him for the trouble he took in accompanying Henshaw.
